description: template: Grammar fix for template documentation.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=6577cd4b870f ***

template: Grammar fix for template documentation.

R=golang-dev, rsc
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/4944043

Committer: Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org>

s/in/to/ and sure
On Aug 24, 2011 11:54 PM, <wcn@google.com> wrote:
> Reviewers: golang-dev_googlegroups.com,
>
> Message:
> Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
>
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://go.googlecode.com/hg
>
>
> Description:
> template: Grammar fix for template documentation.
>
> Please review this at http://codereview.appspot.com/4944043/
>
> Affected files:
> M src/pkg/template/doc.go
>
>
> Index: src/pkg/template/doc.go
> ===================================================================
> --- a/src/pkg/template/doc.go
> +++ b/src/pkg/template/doc.go
> @@ -294,7 +294,7 @@
> when it is executed.
>
> The second way to build a template set is to use Set's Add method to add a
> -parsed template to a set. A template may be bound at most one set. If
> it's
> +parsed template to a set. A template may be bound in at most one set. If
> it's
> necessary to have a template in multiple sets, the template definition
> must be
> parsed multiple times to create distinct *Template values.
>
>
>

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, rsc@google.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

subject: code review 4944043: template: Grammar fix for template documentation.
